catalyst.source: The constructed 2D/2D/0D TiO 2 /C 3 N 4 /Ti 3 C 2 composite heterojunction photocatalyst exhibits enhanced CO 2 reduction activity compared to TiO 2 , C 3 N 4 , TiO 2 /C 3 N 4 , C 3 N 4 /Ti 3 C 2 for CO and CH 4 production.
catalyst.context: Herein, two-dimensional (2D) TiO 2 mesoporous nanosheets with three to four C 3 N 4 layers grown in situ are employed to design a core-shell 2D/2D van der Waals heterojunction (TiO 2 /C 3 N 4 ).Edge-terminated zero-dimensional (0D) Ti 3 C 2 MXene quantum dots (TCQD) are subsequently integrated in the C 3 N 4 surface via electrostatic interactions.The constructed 2D/2D/0D TiO 2 /C 3 N 4 /Ti 3 C 2 composite heterojunction photocatalyst exhibits enhanced CO 2 reduction activity compared to TiO 2 , C 3 N 4 , TiO 2 /C 3 N 4 , C 3 N 4 /Ti 3 C 2 for CO and CH 4 production.A step-scheme (S-scheme) charge transfer mechanism operates for the prepared samples during CO 2 reduction, as authenticated by in situ X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy and electron paramagnetic resonance analysis.This study provides a paradigm of a rational structural design for regulating the number and type of heterointerfaces and further insights into the mechanism of multijunction photocatalysts.

catalyst.source: Subsequently, terminated TCQD were electrostatically assembled with the C 3 N 4 shell, producing the TiO 2 /C 3 N 4 / Ti 3 C 2 (T-CN-TC) composite.
catalyst.context: Synthesis of 2D TiO 2 nanosheets with single-layered mesopores: 2D mesoporous TiO 2 (T) nanosheets were synthesized via hydrothermalinduced solvent-confined monomicelle self-assembly 33.The detailed steps are given in Supporting Information. Synthesis of mesoporous TiO 2 /C 3 N 4 core-shell nanosheets and TCQD-modified TiO 2 /C 3 N 4 nanosheets: Ultrathin C 3 N 4 coating was deposited onto the surface of TiO 2 nanosheets through the thermal condensation of urea, forming TiO 2 /C 3 N 4 core-shell nanosheets, which were denoted as T-CN.Subsequently, terminated TCQD were electrostatically assembled with the C 3 N 4 shell, producing the TiO 2 /C 3 N 4 / Ti 3 C 2 (T-CN-TC) composite.The process is described in Supporting Information. Synthesis of TCQD: Ti 3 AlC 2 bulk was selectively etched into Ti 3 C 2 MXene with HF (48 ) for 24 h 30.The obtained powder was washed with ultrapure water until its pH was close to 6 and then dried for storage.Then, 1 g of Ti 3 C 2 MXene was dispersed into 100 mL of dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO) and then sonicated for 12 h in an N 2 -protected environment.The suspension was centrifuged and washed with ultrapure water three times to remove residual DMSO.Subsequently, the precipitant was redispersed in 100 mL of ultrapure water, and the pH of the mixture was adjusted to 9 with ammonia.After vigorous ultrasonication for 1 h, the mixer was transferred to a Teflon-lined autoclave and held at 100 C for 6 h.The Ti 3 C 2 MXene quantum dots solution was obtained after the resulting suspension was filtered with the membrane (200 nm) and stored prior to use, which was labeled as TCQD.The precipitate was denoted as Ti 3 C 2 bulk. The details of characterization are available in Supporting Information. CO 2 photoreduction experiments are described in detail in Supporting Information. Computational details are available in Supporting Information.

catalyst.source: CO and CH 4 yields resulting from the CO 2 photoreduction in the presence of T-CN-TC exceed the yields offered by T or CN by three and eight times, respectively.
catalyst.context: In a nutshell, a unique 2D van der Waals heterostructure, TCQD decorated TiO 2 /C 3 N 4 core-shell nanosheets with a good dispersion, are constructed via interfacial self-assembly.CO and CH 4 yields resulting from the CO 2 photoreduction in the presence of T-CN-TC exceed the yields offered by T or CN by three and eight times, respectively.Experimental and theoretical results reveal that the constructed dualheterojunctions (the S-scheme heterojunction at the TiO 2/ C 3 N 4 interface and the Schottky heterojunction at the C 3 N 4 /TCQD interface) play major roles in the enhanced photocatalytic activity and jointly expedite the separation, migration, and utilization of photogenerated charge carriers with strong redox capacities.The edge modification of TCQD with amine groups favors intimate coupling with C 3 N 4 , improves catalytic reactivity, and provides additional surface reaction active sites.The ultrathin 2D-2D van der Waals structure of TiO 2 /C 3 N 4 provides a large contact interface and short electron transfer routes.This work elucidates the elaborate design and provides a strong proof supporting multijunction photocatalysts.Such a multijunction design protocol is anticipated to be extended to the fabrication of other photocatalysts.TCQD also act as an electron sink that can be used as a potential cocatalyst in photocatalysis.
